q: Donald Rumsfeld promised change but the next day Sept. 11-- the world changed and in the rush to fund the war on terrorism, the war on waste seems to have been forgotten. Just last week President Bush announced, my 2003 budget calls for more than$ 48 billion in new defense spending. More money for the Pentagon, CBS News Correspondent Vince Gonzales reports, while its own auditors admit the military can not account for 25 percent of what it spends." contemplated leaving, even after Dick Cheney told him that he had to stay. In May 2004, when Bush visited the Pentagon and then repaired to Donald Rumsfeld 's office, the secretary handed him yet another I-quit letter. I have concluded that the damage from the acts of abuse that happened on my watch, by individuals for whose conduct I am ultimately responsible, can best be responded to by my resignation, it said.
